# Land Development Services

__

#### Land Development Services Alert:

CONTACT INFORMATION:  Monday through Thursday, 8 a.m. - 4 p.m. and Friday, 9:15 a.m. - 4 p.m. Please note that visitors may not be added to in-person queues past 3:45 p.m. 

__

703-222-0801 TTY 711

__

LandDevelopmentServices@fairfaxcounty.gov

__

12055 Government Center Pkwy  
Fairfax, VA 22035

__

fairfaxcounty

__

Bill Hicks  
Director

# Site Application Center

If you have not logged onto any LDS platforms and have questions about land disturbance activities on your property, please visit Land Disturbance 101. Learn more about Site Development and Inspections.

**Pre-Plan submission: You have already identified your plan type need and have had an engineer create site plans for your project. Here is how the rest of the process will work:******

## 

__

What is PLUS?

__

Site Records Viewer

__

Jade

## Step 1: Submission

Submit your plans electronically using PLUS:

Getting Started with PLUS

Work with Records in PLUS

Digital Plan Room (DPR) in PLUS

Minor Revisions

## Step 2: Plan Review

Once submitted, LDS Site Application Center staff begin the plan review process.

You can track your plan while it’s under review; you will also respond to any comments reviewers make on your plan:

  * Check Record Status
  * Signature Set Coordination for Site-Related Plans
  * Reviewing Issues, Conditions & Notes
  * Upload Corrected Plans



## Step 3: Plan Approval & Land Disturbance Permit Issuance

Once you receive approval on your site-related plans, you will do the following:

  * Review the Meeting Approval Condition page to learn how to view Conditions of Approval in PLUS and determine if your plan has any outstanding conditions that need to be resolved.
  * This form is used to submit required documents.



## Step 4: Apply for Your Permit

Submit approved site plans to obtain the necessary permit for the next step in your site and building project.

  * **Apply for a permit in PLUS**



### Related Resources

Land Disturbance 101

LDS Forms and Publications

Land Development Information History

  * JADE (Fairfax County GIS viewer)
  * Site Development Pre/Post Submission Meeting Request Form
  * Submitting House Location Plats



## Need More Help?

For questions or additional information, please contact the Site Application Center staff via email or telephone **703-222-0801, TTY 711**. 

  
Need Help? Call **703-222-0801** , **TTY 711**.

Monday through Thursday from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. and Friday from 9:15 a.m. to 4 p.m.

  * LDS Permit Library: Access guides to navigate every record type in PLUS.
  * Letters to Industry: Subscribe for LDS announcements, notices, and tech bulletins.
  * Meet With Staff: Find a staff member to help you with the permit process.

metadata.title: Site Application Center | Land Development Services
metadata.description: Fairfax County, Virginia - The Site Application Center is responsible for the triage, acceptance, and distribution of all site-related plans, including related documentation and fees.
metadata.keywords: site, site-related plan, land disturbance, site plan, minor site plan, infill lot, grading plan, ldsnet, projectdox, sharefile, land disturbance permit
